name: Kepler-53
scenarioDescription:
The Kepler-53 Exoplanetary System

Kepler-53 is a star with 0.98 times the mass of the Sun, and 0.89 times its radius. It is located 4631.74 light years away from the solar system.

Kepler-53 is known to have 3 exoplanets in orbit around it.

Kepler-53 d

Kepler-53 d was discovered by the Kepler observatory using the transit method. Its discovery was announced in 2014-03. Its semi-major axis is 0.09 astronomical units, as compared to Earth's which is 1 astronomical unit. It takes 9.75 Earth days to complete an orbit around its host star, Kepler-53.

The mass of Kepler-53 d is 5.83 times the mass of Earth. The radius of Kepler-53 d is 2.12 that of Earth. At 5.83 Earth masses, Kepler-53 d is a so called Super Earth. Super Earths could be terrestrial worlds like Earth, but they could also be ocean worlds or terrestrial worlds wrapped in a substantial atmosphere, in which case some refer to them as Mini Neptunes. No Super Earths are known to exist in our solar system, but if it exists, the so-called Planet Nine could very well be a super Earth, as it is hypothesized to have a mass between five and ten Earth masses.
description: 3D visualisation and gravity simulation of the exoplanet system Kepler-53, which contains 3 planets and was discovered by Kepler.
